intro: Calamosagus scaphiger, commonly known as the swamp reed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its inflorescence consists of a spike-like arrangement of small, clustered flowers. Calamosagus scaphiger plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
